result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Parez

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Christopher J. Parez in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher J. Parez appeared by video means. Status conference held. Offer received by defense. Defense requests plea/sentencing date. Next hearing to be held in person.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Defendant Christopher J. Parez in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status conference.  Defense is waiting for an offer and requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Christopher J. Parez in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($1,000.00) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

03:23 PM Defendant Christopher J. Parez not in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Oral No Contact Order with: Ashley Clemmer (co-defendant).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher J. Parez in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher J. Parez
Current: 414 Mooreland Blvd #200, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 04-19-2022)
Prior: 311 S Grandview Blvd., Waukesha, WI 53188
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/19/22 @ 2:30p
